titleStmt.title: Charles S. Savage to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1974

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Gov Thos E Bramblette
Hon. Sir,

We the undersigned Trustees of the town of Germantown Kenty, duly qualified as such, would respectfully represent that James A Rackley was some time since legaly elected as Police Judge of our town; but in consequence of the excitement then existing, application for a commission failed to be made, and our town has suffered a great-deal for the want of an officer properly qualified to administer the law,
Now we would respectfully request your Honor to have issued to the said James A Rackley a commission as Police Judge of Germantown Kenty.

Rsply Signed,
Chas S Savage chrm
L. H. M D W L
Samuel F Pollock
John Downing
J S Froupe

Germantown
Jas A. Rackley
Police Judge
Comd
19th Oct/64
